intro: Richaeia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate richaeia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
